author.name: Sam Turnbull • It Doesn't Taste Like Chicken

description: Tender potatoes are coated in a creamy dreamy dressing with the perfect blend of herbs and seasonings. Easy to make and can be made ahead of time so it's perfect for meal prep, BBQ's, and potlucks.
keywords: best, dressing, easy, mayo, mayonnaise, potato, recipe, salad, vegan

mentions.description: The potato is a starchy, tuberous crop from the perennial nightshade Solanum tuberosum. The word "potato" may refer either to the plant itself or to the edible tuber. In the Andes, where the species is indigenous, there are some other closely related cultivated potato species. Potatoes were introduced outside the Andes region approximately four centuries...
mentions.name: potato

name: Easy Vegan Potato Salad
recipeIngredient: 3 pounds potatoes (any kind, I used Yukon gold), (cut into 1 inch pieces)
1 cup vegan mayonnaise (see notes for subs)
1 tablespoon fresh dill, (finely chopped (or 1 teaspoon dried dill)
1/2 of a red onion, (thinly sliced (about 1/2 cup)

recipeInstructions.text: Add the potatoes in a large pot and cover with water. Bring to a boil, and continue to cook for 5 - 10 minutes until potatoes are fork tender. Drain and let cool. Rinsing with cool water will help the potatoes cool faster.

In a large bowl, mix together the mayonnaise, pickles, vinegar, mustard, celery seed, dill, salt, and pepper. Add the cooled potatoes along with the celery and red onion and gently toss to coat in the dressing. Sprinkle with paprika for garnish before serving. Serve the vegan potato salad fresh or cover and store in the fridge for 3 - 4 days.
